meanings.definition: A person regarded as insignificant or contemptible.
meanings.sent1: The group of twirps sat quietly in the corner of the classroom.
meanings.sent2: Don't pay attention to those twirps; they're not worth your time.
meanings.sent3: The twirps tried to act tough, but everyone knew they were just pretending.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a twirp among the confident students at the party.
meanings.sent5: The movie villain was just a twirp compared to the heroic main character.

meanings.definition: To twist or twirl in a playful or teasing manner.
meanings.sent1: The kids twirped around the playground, laughing and playing.
meanings.sent2: She twirped her hair around her finger while talking on the phone.
meanings.sent3: The cat twirped its tail in excitement when it saw its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The dancer twirped gracefully across the stage, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The wind twirped the leaves off the trees, creating a beautiful dance in the air.
